Package converter.api

Class RestApi

java.lang.Object
converter.api.RestApi
public class RestApi
extends java.lang.Object
This is a currency converter program in java using a REST API. program will convert currency between converter USD (United States Dollars), converter ILS (Israeli Shekel) and converter EUR (the official currency of the European Union).
Author:
Noam Heller
See Also:
https://currencyscoop.com/

  • Method Details

    • isValid

      private boolean isValid​(java.lang.String usersChoice)
      check if users choice is valid (1/2/3)
      Parameters:
      usersChoice - represents users choice of converter.
      Returns:
      boolean true if valid, false if not.

    • converterChoice

      private java.lang.String converterChoice()
      asks user to make a choice,if valid returns users choice, if not - let him try again.
      Returns:
      users choice

    • valueToConvert

      private double valueToConvert()
      asks user to enter amount of money to convert. catches exception of invalid input, let user choose again until input is value.
      Returns:
      amount of money user entered

    • startOver

      private boolean startOver()
      choose to continue converting or not. y for yes (returns true), n for no (returns false). confirms input is valid
      Returns:
      true to continue, false to end

    • USDtoILS

      private Result USDtoILS​(double toConvert)
      getting conversion value from REST Api serializing Json conversion value into a result obj if connection to server unavailable / problem with json, using default rate.

    • ILStoUSD

      private Result ILStoUSD​(double toConvert)
      getting conversion value from REST Api serializing Json conversion value into a result obj if connection to server unavailable / problem with json, using default rate.

    • EURtoILS

      private Result EURtoILS​(double toConvert)
      getting conversion value from REST Api serializing Json conversion value into a result obj if connection to server unavailable / problem with json, using default rate.

    • resultFileWriter

      private void resultFileWriter​(java.util.ArrayList<Result> valuesList)
      writes value list into a text file, and opens it.
      Parameters:
      valuesList - result type array list with users history of converting.

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      main method
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException
